default: (a) a {@item quarterstaff|phb} or (b) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and {@item crossbow bolts (20)|phb|20 bolts}
(a) a {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon} or (b) two {@item dagger|phb}
(a) an {@item explorer's pack|phb} or (b) a {@item schoolar's pack|phb}
(a) {@item leather armor|phb|Leather armor}, and {@item book|phb|a field journal}.

entries: An unassuming mouse skitters down a castle corridor. It seems to have a clear destination in mind: the castle's forbidden library. The guards pay it no mind as it scampers past. It squeezes underneath the door to the library. The lights are out; the library empty. The mouse begins to grow, its features shifting. Quickly, it takes the form of a curious halfling. The halfling smiles, looking around at their treasure. The halfling chooses a tome on extinct creatures, and begins to read...

An older elf sits on a log, unperturbed by the family of apes cavorting around them. The elf smiles wistfully, experiencing behavior and interactions that have never been documented before. They make sketches of the apes, noting their personalities, their likes and dislikes. Suddenly, one of the largest apes decides he doesn't like the elf's presence. He rushes over, puffing his chest out in intimidation. Never losing their smile, the elf concentrates for a moment, and shifts their form into that of a small, unthreatening ape child. The silverback, satisfied, walks away...

A group of thugs are terrorizing a village. The village has no one to stand up to these villains. That is, until a young half-orc steps forward. The half-orc tells them to leave the village, and never return. The thugs look at one another, and then begin to laugh. In their revelry, they don't notice that the half-orc's skin has begun to turn into scales. Sharp teeth emerge from their gums; their head and jaws begin to grow. In no more than a moment, an extinct king of beasts stands before the interlopers. They hesitate briefly before screaming and running from the apparition, never to return...

An animus is a person solely dedicated to the practice of shapechanging magic. Many spells and abilities exist to change one's form, but the animus takes these abilities further, allowing them to access secrets unknown to other practitioners of magic.An animus studies living creatures like a wizard studies magic, dedicated to perfecting its art.

entries.name: Biological Imperative
entries: An animus is one who studies life and evolution, documenting nature and researching its change. To most animi, if one studies a creature's form, habits, and biological impulses, one can then tap into the shapechanging magic required to become that creature.An animus is a scientist first and foremost, a student of nature and researcher of animals and creatures of all kinds.

entries.name: Call of the Wild
entries: The impulse to study nature and fauna forces animi at some point to leave behind the dusty scrolls and forgotten tomes of those who have come before them, and add to the knowledge of the world.Animi seek to discover things about life that were previously unknown, using their power to study creatures well enough to walk among them, unnoticed. While animi constantly add to their notes and research, they mostly strive to uncover new discoveries, or disprove what was thought to be fact.

fluff.name: Animus

entries.name: Creating an Animus
entries: As you make your animus character, think about the science you plan to conduct. Did you study under a master animus, looking to build on the foundations of their research?Are you from a small community, only finding the magic of shapechanging through experimentation on your own? Did you find its power through a particularly close association with certain creatures, discovering the ability accidentally?

Also think about the type of research you plan to conduct. Are you interested in insects and bugs, those creatures which others would find abhorrent? Will you research plants, or oozes? Or will you study those creatures which some consider to be the most powerful of all, dragons?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make an animus quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Intelligence your highest ability score, followed by Constitution. Second, choose the {@background veterinarian|McToomin27:Animus} background. Third, choose the following forms for your field journal: {@creature boar}, {@creature cat}, {@creature elk}, {@creature giant wolf spider}, {@creature panther}, and {@creature rat}.

optionalfeature.name: Armordillo
entries: When you aren't wearing armor, your AC equals 10 + your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Beast of Burden
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

optionalfeature.name: Bestial Power
entries: Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Stealth}. You gain proficiency with the chosen skill.
You can select this edge multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different skill.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

optionalfeature.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for 1 hour.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Bug
entries: You can use an action to begin or cease shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Mimicry
entries: You can mimic sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds you make can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check opposed by your Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check.

optionalfeature.name: Cowering Prey
entries: After you are hit with an attack and take damage, you can use your reaction to move up to half your speed. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Dark Camouflage
entries: While you are in dim light or darkness, you can use a bonus action to take the {@action Hide} action.

optionalfeature.name: Frog Legs
entries: Your long jump is up to 20 feet and your high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

optionalfeature.name: Horns of the Ram
entries: When you use your action to {@action Dash}, you can use a bonus action to make one melee weapon attack or to make a {@action shove} attack against a creature.

optionalfeature.name: Tiger Pounce
entries: If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hit it with a melee attack on the same turn, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d6} damage from the attack. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Waterborne
entries: You can breathe both air and water. You gain a swimming speed of 25 feet and a walking speed of 25 feet if your walking speed is not already faster. If you already have a swimming speed, the speed increases by 25 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Ape's Strength
entries: You have advantage on ability checks made to {@action grapple} or {@action shove} other creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Constrictor
entries: When you successfully {@action grapple} a creature, the target is {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. You cannot constrict more than one target in this way at once.

optionalfeature.name: Elephant Stance
entries: When you fail an ability check or saving throw which would cause you to be knocked {@condition prone} or moved from your space, you can use your reaction to reroll the check or saving throw. You must keep the second roll.

optionalfeature.name: Frog Slime
entries: You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to resist becoming {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}.

optionalfeature.name: Chameleon
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks made to hide. If you remain motionless for 1 minute, you are {@condition invisible} until you use an action or move.

optionalfeature.name: Echolocation
entries: You can use a bonus action to focus your senses. Until the beginning of your next turn, you have {@sense blindsight} to a range of 60 feet. You cannot use this edge if you are {@condition deafened}.

optionalfeature.name: Kestrel Switftness
entries: Your speed increases by 10 feet. This applies to all forms of movement.

optionalfeature.name: Defensive Curl
entries: When an attacker you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

optionalfeature.name: Earthborne
entries: You gain {@sense tremorsense|MM} to a range of 30 feet, and a burrowing speed of 30 feet. You can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, you don't disturb the material you move through. If you already have a burrowing speed, the speed increases by 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Wings of the Falcon
entries: You gain a fly speed of 60 feet.
If you already have a flying speed, the speed increases by 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Wolf Pack
entries: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies are within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all of its hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Crag Hide
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only you (not an area).

optionalfeature.name: Fear Aura
entries: Any hostile target to you that starts its turn within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw, unless you are {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the target is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. If the target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to your Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Thorned Hide
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you deal {@damage 1d4} piercing damage to any creature you are {@condition grappled|grappling} or any creature which is {@condition grappled|grappling} you.

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Bounty
entries: You can cast either the {@spell entangle} or the {@spell goodberry} spell, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. You can cast this spells while in your Plant Shape.

optionalfeature.name: Pollen Cloud
entries: You release a cloud of pollen each time you take damage. Each other target within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to your Pollen Cloud for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Photosynthesis
entries: Whenever you are in bright light and Take Root, you regain the maximum number of hit points possible from any healing.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Spores
entries: Whenever you take damage from a creature within 5 feet of you, you release a cloud of spores towards the creature that damaged you. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Timeless Body
entries: For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year, and you can't be magically aged.

optionalfeature.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: You can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature within 120 feet of you that can understand a language.

optionalfeature.name: Rampage
entries: When you reduce a target to 0 hit points with a melee attack on your turn, you can take a bonus action to move up to half your speed and make a melee weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Brave
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

optionalfeature.name: Treasure Sense
entries: You can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals and stones, such as coins and gems, within 60 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Damage Immunity
entries: You have immunity to the type of damage you choose for your Draconic Hallmark.

optionalfeature.name: Avoidance
entries: If you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

optionalfeature.name: Telepathic Bond
entries: The range of your telepathic link to your familiar increases to 1 mile.

optionalfeature.name: Mounted Combat
entries: You cannot be knocked off of a mount unless both you and your mount are {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Battle Formation
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws while within 5 feet of your familiar.

optionalfeature.name: Far Shape
entries: You can use ki points to morph your familiar's form so long as it is within range of your telepathic link.

optionalfeature.name: Steadfast
entries: You can't be {@condition frightened} while you can see an allied creature within 30 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Morph Dancing
entries: Whenever your familiar would be reduced to 0 hit points while it is morphed within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction and expend additional ki points to morph your familiar into a new form. Any excess damage your familiar takes carries over to its new form.

optionalfeature.name: Web Walker
entries: While in contact with a web, you know the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web. You ignore movement restrictions caused by webbing.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Sense
entries: You can detect whether a substance is poisonous by taste, touch, or smell.

optionalfeature.name: Spider Silk
entries: You can expend 2 ki points as an action to cast the {@spell web} spell. You can cast this spell while morphed.

optionalfeature.name: Spider Climb
entries: You can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Bombardier
entries: You can use an action to spray a 30-foot cone of acid. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking half as much damage on a success. The damage of this spray is equal to {@dice 1d6} + a number of {@dice d6}s equal to your animus level divided by four (rounded down).

optionalfeature.name: Shimmering
entries: You can expend 4 ki points as an action to cast the {@spell confusion} spell. You can cast this spell while morphed.

optionalfeature.name: Heart Sight
entries: You can use an action to touch a creature, which must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, you know the creature's current emotional state. If a target's saving throw is successful, it is immune to your Heart Sight for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Fae Charm
entries: You can use an action to target one humanoid or beast that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the target can see you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed}. The {@condition charmed} creature regards you as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under your control, it takes your requests or actions in the most favorable way it can. Each time you or your allies do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts for 1 hour or until you die, are on a different plane of existence from the target, or you end the effect as a bonus action. If a target's saving throw is successful, it is immune to your Fae Charm for the next 24 hours.
Once you use this edge, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Fae Step
entries: You can expend 2 ki points as a bonus action to cast the {@spell misty step} spell. You can cast this spell while morphed.

optionalfeature.name: Sensing Bond
entries: You can use an action to target a willing creature within 30 feet of you. You can communicate telepathically with your bonded partner while you are on the same plane of existence.

In addition, your partner can use an action to see through your eyes and hear what you hear until the start of their next turn. During this time, your partner is {@condition deafened|deaf} and {@condition blinded|blind} with regard to its own senses.
You remain bonded until you use an action to choose a new partner or until either partner chooses to end the bond (no action required).

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: You can see 30 feet into the Ethereal Plane when you are on the Material Plane, and vice versa.
In addition, within 30 feet of you, magical {@condition invisible|invisibility} fails to conceal anything from your sight.

optionalfeature.name: Border Crossing
entries: You can spend 1 hour in deep meditation, taking no actions and expending no movement. At the end of this time, you can cast the {@spell plane shift} spell without expending ki points, targeting yourself and up to eight willing creatures within 10 feet of you. You cannot banish an unwilling creature to another plane when you cast the spell in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: You can perfectly recall any path you have traveled within the past 30 days.

optionalfeature.name: Tendril
entries: You can have up to four tendrils at a time which grow from you and can be used to make attacks. When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can replace any of your attacks with a tendril attack. A tendril attack is a melee weapon attack with a reach of 10 feet which deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage on a hit. You can use your Intelligence for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Foul Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to your Foul Stench for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Immutable Form
entries: You can choose to be immune to any spell or effect that would alter your form.

optionalfeature.name: Detect Sentience
entries: You can sense the presence and location of any target within 60 feet of you that has an Intelligence score of 3 or higher, regardless of interposing barriers, unless the target is protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Two Heads
entries: You grow a second head. You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Sense
entries: You always know which way is north, and you can't become lost when traveling to a place you have been before except through magical means.

optionalfeature.name: Electric Shock
entries: When a creature you can see hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reactino to deliver an electric shock to the attacker, which takes an amount of lightning damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Jet Propulsion
entries: You grow small siphons that allow you to quickly move around. You can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Invisible in Water
entries: You are {@condition invisible} while fully immersed in water.

optionalfeature.name: Regenerate
entries: If you lose a body part, the missing part regrows and returns to full functionality after {@d 1d6 + 1} days if you have at least 1 hit point for the entire duration.

optionalfeature.name: Nondetection
entries: You can't be targeted or detected by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

optionalfeature.name: Ooze Friendship
entries: Oozes regard you and your allies as a friendly and non-threatening presence. Oozes do not regard you as hostile unless they have been specifically ordered or compelled to attack, or if you or your companions have done anything harmful to the ooze in the past 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Acidic Touch
entries: You can choose for your melee weapon attacks to deal acid damage instead of their normal damage.

optionalfeature.name: Transparent
entries: Even when you are in plain sight, it takes a successful Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check (DC equal to your morph save DC) to spot you if you have neither moved nor attacked.

optionalfeature.name: Adhesive
entries: You can choose to adhere to anything that touches you. A Huge or smaller target adhered to you is also {@condition grappled} by you (escape DC equal to your ki save DC).

optionalfeature.name: Inscrutable
entries: You are immune to any effect that would sense your emotions or read your thoughts, as well as any divination spell that you refuse. Wisdom ({@skill insight}) checks made to ascertain your intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Corrode Metal
entries: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits you corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cummulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If it's penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits you is destroyed after dealing damage.
Additionally, you can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Movement
entries: You can move through nonmagical difficult terrain without expending extra movement.

optionalfeature.name: Power of the Elements
entries: When you gain this bestial edge, choose one of the following spells: {@spell fire bolt}, {@spell hydro blast|McToomin27:Animus}, {@spell skyward fling|McToomin27:Animus}, or {@spell stoneguard|McToomin27:Animus}. You can cast the spell you chose even while morphed.
You can choose this edge multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different spell.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Aura
entries: At the start of each of your turns, each creature within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 1d4} acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Water Walk
entries: You can stand and move on liquid surfaces as if they were solid ground.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Absorption
entries: When you are subjected to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you can choose to take no damage and instead regain a number of hit points equal to your animus level. Once you use this edge, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Death Burst
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you release a powerful burst of elemental energy. Each other target within 15 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw or take an amount of acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (your choice) equal to {@damage 1d6} + a number of d6s equal to your animus level divided by three (rounded down) on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Prehensile Tail
entries: You grow a tail that can be finely manipulated. You can interact with one additional object or feature of the environment for free during your turn using your tail. You can use your tail to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, pour the contents out of a vial, or other, similar actions. Your tail can't attack, use a shield or weapon, activate magical items, or carry more than 5 pounds.

optionalfeature.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of your turn, you can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls you make during that turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points in any form, you can choose to be reduced to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this edge, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Slippery Escape
entries: You don't provoke opportunity attacks when you move out of an enemy's reach.

optionalfeature.name: Iron Stomach
entries: You have immunity to disease and poison.

optionalfeature.name: Assassinate
entries: You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn in a combat yet. In addition, any hit you score against such a creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The Oozeling can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The Oozeling can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The kraken can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kraken makes three tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The kraken has eight tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Medium or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the kraken is thrown up to 30 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A small knife, a {@item healer's kit|PHB}, an {@item herbalism kit|PHB}, a set of heavy gloves, a smock to protect clothing, and a pouch containing 15 gp

entries.name: Focus of Practice
entries: Most veterinarians tend to the needs of specific types of creatures. You can work with your GM to determine a type of creatures that you work with, or you can choose from or roll on the table below to determine a focus of practice for your character.

entries.name: Feature: House Call
entries: Anyone who knows of your trade and has a beloved pet or animal companion which has experienced any kind of ailment will welcome you into their home. You can usually find a place to hide, rest, or relax with such a person, and they will shield you from the law or from anyone else who is searching for you, though they will not risk their lives for you.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: A vet's life is one of tough work, with moments of triumph and happiness when a beloved pet or a needed working animal is saved, and moments of loss when they creatures cannot be healed. Vets must steel themselves against the dark times and always look forward to the light.

rows: I can't bring myself to harm another living creature, unless it's necessary.
When I see a creature in distress, I automatically leap into action.
I am constantly taking notes about the strange things I see.
I wash my hands constantly to remain clean.
I like to narrate what I am doing out loud.
I can't help but diagnose common ailments I see at all times.
I enjoy telling stories of the times I felt like a hero by saving a creature's life.
I am calm and cool under pressure.
{@b Oath.} I swore an oath to give all creatures as long and as healthy a life as possible. (Lawful)
{@b Healer.} No creature should suffer from an ailment that I could prevent. (Good)
{@b Knowledge.} We can always learn from others, and we should teach others what we know. (Neutral)
{@b Greed.} I heal beloved companions, so people are willing to pay whatever I want for the service. (Evil)
{@b Turmoil.} I do what I can, but the power over life and death does not lie in my hands. (Chaos)
{@b Medic.} No creature should have to live with suffering that could be prevented. (Any)
My beloved pet was killed by an ailment I now know how to prevent; I must keep others from suffering as I did.
A blight has befallen the creatures from my home, I must find the cure.
I am gathering as much knowledge as possible so I can educate others.
I must hide from the wrath of a powerful ruler who blames me for the death of an animal companion.
I haven't been home in some time, always finding myself called to new places for aid.
I advertise my services as a healer of animals, but I actually work for the criminal underground, healing them from injuries that would be difficult to explain.
I allowed a creature to die due to a personal grudge with its owner.
I fell into this trade by accident, and don't actually like animals.
I am willing to let a creature suffer if I can learn something from it.
The sight of blood makes me feel faint.
I am haunted by the memory of every creature I could not save.
I tend to rush my work, making mistakes I wouldn't otherwise make if I were more meticulous.

item.name: Magic Ink (1-ounce bottle)
entries: When you complete a drawing using this ink and succeed on a DC 13 {@skill Arcana} check, you can choose for the drawing to come to life. The illustration will make movements and actions that you decide. If the drawing is of a creature, you can choose for the creature to take actions that would be natural to it. The drawing cannot leave its page, and does not react to any outside influence.
You can use a tool proficiency (such as {@item calligrapher's supplies|phb} or {@item painter's supplies|phb}) in place of the {@skill Arcana} check required to bring the drawing to life.

classFeature.name: Ki
entries: Your dedicated research into the life force of all living beings—called ki—allows you to use this mysterial energy to change your shape into those of ferocious beasts.

entries.name: Ki Points
entries: Your access to ki is represented by ki points. Your animus level determines the number of points you have, as shown in the Ki Points column of the Animus table.

You can expend these ki points to transform your body into those of beasts you have studied (see Morphing, below). When you expend a ki point, it is unavailable to you until you finish a short or long rest, at the end of which you draw all of your expended ki back into yourself. You must spend at least 30 minutes of the rest meditating to regain your ki points.

entries.name: Field Journal
entries: At 1st level, you have a field journal containing information on six beasts of your choice that have a challenge rating of {@filter 1/4|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/4]|type=beast|miscellaneous=!swarm} or lower. Your journal is the repository of creatures you have {@i discovered}.

entries.name: Preparing Forms
entries: You prepare the list of beasts that are available for you to morph into. To do so, choose a number of beasts from your field journal that you have discovered equal to your Intelligence modifier + your animus level (a minimum of one creature). The beasts must be of a challenge rating no higher than the maximum CR of creatures you can morph into, as shown in the Max CR column of the Animus table.

You are also subject to the limitations shown on the Animal Morphs table. For example, at 1st level, you can morph into any beast that has a challenge rating of 1/4 or lower that doesn't have a flying or a swimming speed.

entries.caption: Animal Morphs
rows: {@filter No flying or swimming speed|bestiary|type=beast|speed type=!fly;!swim|miscellaneous=!swarm}

entries: You can change your list of prepared forms when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of forms requires time spent studying your journal: at least 1 minute per challenge rating for each creature on your list (a minimum of 1 minute per creature).

entries.name: Morphing
entries: You can use a bonus action to expend a number of ki points equal to a prepared beast's challenge rating (a minimum of 1 ki point) to assume the shape of that creature. You can stay in a beast's shape for a number of hours equal to half your animus level, rounded down (a minimum of one hour). You then revert to your normal form unless you expend additional ki points. You can revert to your normal form earlier by using a bonus action on your turn. You automatically revert if you fall {@condition unconscious}, drop to 0 hit points, or die.
When you morph into a creature, the following rules apply:

items: Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but you retain your alignment, personality, hit points and Hit Dice, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the beast. If the beast has the same proficiency as you and the bonus in its stat block is higher than yours, use the beast's bonus instead of yours.

When you morph into a creature of challenge rating 1/8 or higher, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to five times the challenge rating of the beast (a minimum of 5) + your Intelligence modifier.

You can't cast spells, and your ability to take any action that requires hands is limited to the capabilities of your beast form. Morphing does not break your concentration if you are already concentrating when you morph.

You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so. However, you can't use any of your special senses, such as darkvision, unless your new form also has that sense.

You choose whether your equipment falls to the ground in your space, merges into your new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the GM decides whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, based on the creature's shape and size. Your equipment doesn't change size or shape to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge with it. Equipment that merges with the form has no effect until you leave the form.
If the beast has any lair or legendary actions, you can't use them. You do not gain any languages or equipment.
You can continue to speak aloud in your normal voice during your Wild Shape transformations.

entries.name: Ki Ability
entries: Intelligence is your ki ability for your ki features. The power of your ki is determined by your study of the mysterious force that gives life to all creatures. When you are morphed into a creature, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for any of the creature's traits or actions. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when making an attack roll as a beast.
In addition, any spell you learn as an animus is considered a ki feature for you, so you use your ki ability whenever a spell mentions your spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Learning Beasts of Higher CR
entries: Each time you gain an animus level, you can add two beasts of your choice as {@i discoveries} to your field journal. Each of these creatures must be of a challenge rating which you can morph into, as shown in the Max CR column of the Animus table. On your adventures, you might find more creatures that you can add to your field journal (see the {@b Your Field Journal} sidebar).

entries.name: Your Field Journal
entries: The creatures you study and add to your field journal as you gain levels reflect the research you conduct on your own, as well as intellectual breakthroughs you have had about the energy of life. You can spend time studying creatures in the wild to add to your journal, as well as copying accounts of beasts you've never seen before written and sketched by others.
There are two types of recordings you can make into your field journal: {@i sketches} and {@i discoveries}.

entries.name: Sketches
entries: These are quick pictures and notes you can jot down when you have seen a creature. You can make sketches of any creature, not just those you can morph into. To make a sketch of a creature, you must have seen it alive or dead but not decomposed (subject to your GM's discretion) for at least 1 minute within the past 24 hours. It takes 1 hour to make sketches of a creature, which can be done during a short or long rest.
Simply having sketches of a creature is not enough to be able to morph into it. Sketches are used to remember creatures which you come across, but which you are not ready to morph into yet.

entries.name: Discoveries
entries: When you are ready to attempt to morph into a creature, you must spend time drawing its form with special {@item Magic Ink (1-ounce bottle)|McToomin27:Animus|magic inks} into your journal. You can only attempt to turn your sketches into a discovery if the creature is one that you could currently Wild Shape into.

This process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp per challenge rating of the creature (a minimum of 2 hours and 50 gp). The cost represents parchment and enough of the magic inks necessary to bring the creature's image to life. Once you have spent this time and money, you can prepare the creature's form for morphing.
Once a creature is recorded as a discovery in your journal, its image appears to move on the pages, mimicking the creature's normal behavior in life.

You can also use sketches or discoveries created by other creatures (such as those that might be found in another explorer's field journal or sketches in old books) to transcribe creatures into your journal, so long as the creature is sufficiently described and sketched (subject to your GM's discretion).

entries.name: Replacing the Journal
entries: You can copy a discovered creature's form from your own journal into another book using the process described above. You must still spend the time and money transcribing the creature's form into the new book to ensure that the minute details of the creature are preserved.

If you lose your field journal, you can use the same procedure to transcribe the creatures that you currently have prepared into a new journal. Filling out the remainder of your field journal requires you to study new creatures as normal.

entries.name: The Journal's Appearance
entries: Your field journal is a unique compilation of drawings, notes, and moving images. It might be a finely-bound tome of creatures you discovered in a forgotten library and added to, or even just a loose collection of sheets of parchment barely held together with frayed strapping.

entries.name: Multiclassing: Ki
entries: If you already have the Ki feature and gain a level in a class that also grants the feature, you add all ki points you gain from both classes to the same pool. These ki points are not tracked separately, so you can spend any of your ki points on any ki features you have gained from either class.

classFeature.name: Savage Attack
entries: At 1st level, you have the ability to mimic an attack from a beast, even if you have not morphed into that creature. Your body momentarily shifts to make this attack, such as growing large claws, long fangs, or even new body parts like horns or a tail. When you finish a long rest and prepare forms for morphing, you can choose one melee attack from your prepared forms.

When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can replace any of your attacks with a savage attack. You make this attack as if you were morphed into the creature you chose. You can make your savage attack even while morphed into another creature.
The maximum challenge rating of creature you can choose a savage attack from increases to CR 1 when you reach 5th level, CR 2 when you reach 11th level, and CR 3 when you reach 17th level.

classFeature.name: Bestial Edges
entries: In your study of life, you have uncovered the ability to channel the abilities of animals at all times.

At 2nd level, you gain two bestial edges of your choice. A list of the available options can be found on the {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|source=null|feature type=Anim:BE} page. If an edge requires a target to make a saving throw, the saving throw DC is equal to your ki save DC.

When you gain certain animus levels, you gain additional edges of your choice, as shown in the Edges Known column of the Animus table. Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the edges you know and replace it with another edge that you could learn at that level.

classFeature.name: Research Focus
entries: At 3rd level, you begin to focus your studies on particular types of creatures. Choose from the list of available focuses. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th, and 14th levels.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th, 8th, 10th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Benign Form
entries: Starting at 5th level, you gain the ability to morph into small and unassuming creatures easily. You can take 10 minutes to meditate, taking no actions and expending no movement. At the end of this time, you morph into a creature of challenge rating 0 of your choice that you have prepared. This ability acts as morphing, except you do not expend any ki points.

At 15th level, any willing humanoid creatures that you designate that remain within 10 feet of you while you meditate are also morphed into the creature you choose. A creature morphed in this way makes its own choice as to what happens with its equipment, and it can choose to end the effect on itself as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Savage Attack (CR 1)
entries: The maximum challenge rating of creature you can choose a savage attack from increases to CR 1 when you reach 5th level.

classFeature.name: Primal Strikes
entries: Beginning at 6th level, your weapon attacks while morphed as well as your savage attack count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

classFeature.name: Research Focus Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature from your Research Focus.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Wild Speech
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can use an action to cast the {@spell speak with animals} spell without expending ki points. When you cast the spell in this way, you only gain the ability to comprehend and verbally communicate with creatures that you have currently prepared for morphing.

classFeature.name: Research Focus Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature from your Research Focus.

classFeature.name: Savage Attack (CR 2)
entries: The maximum challenge rating of creature you can choose a savage attack from increases to CR 2 when you reach 11th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ten Thousand Faces
entries: Beginning at 13th level, you can add specific humanoid creatures into your journal as discoveries as you add other creatures. When you prepare and morph into one of these creatures, you change into a physical duplicate of the creature.

classFeature.name: Research Focus Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature from your Research Focus.

classFeature.name: Benign Form Improvement
entries: At 15th level, any willing humanoid creatures that you designate that remain within 10 feet of you while you meditate are also morphed into the creature you choose. A creature morphed in this way makes its own choice as to what happens with its equipment, and it can choose to end the effect on itself as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Savage Attack (CR 3)
entries: The maximum challenge rating of creature you can choose a savage attack from increases to CR 3 when you reach 17th level.

classFeature.name: Quick Study
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can take 1 minute of study with your field journal to change any or all creatures you currently have prepared for morphing. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Signature Form
entries: When you reach 20th level, you gain mastery over two forms and can morph into them with little effort. Choose two creatures of challenge rating 4 or lower that you have discovered as your signature forms. You always have these forms prepared, and they don't count against the number of forms you have prepared. You can morph into each of these creatures once without expending ki points. When you morph into a signature form in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
By spending 8 hours in study, you can exchange one or both of the signature forms you chose for different forms.

subclassFeature.name: Botany
entries: Botanists study not only those living plants that grow across the world's surface, but also those plants which have taken on moving forms. Plants which can think and act on their own. Botanists sometimes feel more at home among leaves, trees, and foliage than they do amongst people.

subclassFeature.name: Phytological Expertise
entries: Beginning at 3rd level when you choose this research focus, you gain an affinity with plant creatures. Whenever you make an Intelligence ability check related to these creatures, you add your proficiency bonus to the check if you are not already proficient. If you are proficient, your proficiency bonus for any such ability check is doubled.
Additionally, you can prepare and Wild Shape into plant creatures as though they were beasts.

subclassFeature.name: Plant Morph
entries: Also at 3rd level, when you Wild Shape into a beast, you can choose to become a plant creature in the shape of that beast.
While in your Plant Form, the following rules apply:

items: Your type is changed to plant.
Once per turn when a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the attacker takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage.
While you remain motionless, you are indistinguishable from a normal plant.

subclassFeature.name: Take Root
entries: Starting at 7th level, whenever you are morphed into a plant, you can use an action to plant roots into the ground or uproot yourself. While rooted, you gain the following properties:

items: Your movement is reduced to 0, you are immune to the {@condition prone} condition, and you have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

You can use your action to make a {@action grapple} or {@action shove} attack against a creature within 15 feet of you. Once on each of your turns, you can move a target {@condition grappled} by you in this way anywhere within 15 feet of you (no action required).
You can spend 1 minute pulling nutrients from the ground, taking no actions. At the end of this time, you can expend Hit Dice to regain hit points as though you had completed a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Soft Thistles
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can spend 10 minutes weaving a comfortable bed out of plants which ensures a peaceful rest of a Medium or smaller creature. A creature which finishes a short or long rest in such a bed within the next 24 hours recovers from any {@condition blindness}, {@condition deafness}, disease, or {@condition poisoned|poison} affecting it, and if the creature expends Hit Dice to regain hit points, it recovers an additional {@dice 1d6} hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Living with the Land
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can cast any combination of the {@spell plant growth}, {@spell speak with plants}, and {@spell transport via plants} spells a number of times equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of one spell) without expending ki points, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. You can cast these spells while in your Plant Form.

subclassFeature.name: Dracology
entries: Dragons are some of the most fearsome and magical creatures in existence. Their incredible power inspires some of the most dangerous research in an effort to understand these powerful monsters. Dragons are known to be more intelligent than most subjects of animi research, so dracologists must learn to forge relationships with these creatures even as they study them.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Expertise
entries: Beginning at 3rd level when you choose this research focus, you gain an affinity with dragons. Whenever you make an Intelligence ability check related to these creatures, you add your proficiency bonus to the check if you are not already proficient. If you are proficient, your proficiency bonus for any such ability check is doubled.

Additionally, you can prepare and morph into {@filter dragons|bestiary|type=dragon|miscellaneous=!swarm} as though they were beasts. However, as highly magical creatures, it requires more of your energy to morph into them. You must expend one additional ki point to morph into a dragon of challenge rating {@filter 4 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&4]|type=dragon|miscellaneous=!swarm}, and two additional ki points to morph into a dragon of CR {@filter 5 or higher|bestiary|challenge rating=[&4;]|type=dragon|miscellaneous=!swarm}. The draconic forms you take do not have fly or swim speeds until you reach the appropriate level of the Animal Morphs table.

When you use a trait or take an action that can only be used a limited number of times each day (such as an {@creature adult black dragon}'s Legendary Resistance trait), you can only use that feature the number of times per day listed as part of the feature, even if you morph into the creature multiple times or you morph into a different creature with the same feature.
Finally, you can speak, read, and write {@language Draconic}.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Hallmarks
entries: Also at 3rd level, you begin to take on some of the traits of dragons. You can choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. You gain resistance to that type of damage. You can change the type of damage when you finish a short or long rest.
In addition, you can cast the {@spell identify} spell without expending ki points and without needing to provide material components.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Reptile
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the {@action Dash} or {@action Search} actions.

subclassFeature.name: Magical Sight
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you have {@sense blindsight} to a range of 15 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Awe-inspiring
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can use an action to morph into a dragon with a maximum challenge rating equal to your animus level for 10 minutes. When you do so, you must expend a number of ki points equal to the dragon's challenge rating. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Ecology
entries: Animi typically focus their research on certain types of creatures, learning how they live out in the wilderness, away from civilization. Ecologists take this a step further, finding themselves on the edges of society, away from other peoples for long periods of time, researching the interactions between organisms and their environment. These animi study the unique interactions between wild creatures and their environments that are rarely, if ever, seen by others.

subclassFeature.name: Hardy Explorer
entries: Living on the fringes of society has honed your body to be more durable than most. At 3rd level when you choose this research focus, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws made against {@condition exhaustion}.
In addition, you gain proficiency with medium armor, shields, and martial weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Pet Partner
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell, but only as a ritual. When you cast this spell, your familiar is a beast instead of a celestial, fey, or fiend, and you can choose its form from your prepared forms of challenge rating 1/8 or lower in addition to the spell's normal options. Your familiar can take the {@action Attack} action, but cannot take the Multiattack action.

In addition, you can touch your familiar and use a bonus action to expend ki points, morphing your familiar's body instead of your own into a beast you have prepared. Morphing functions the same way for your familiar that it would function for you, except that instead of gaining temporary hit points, your familiar assume's the beast's hit points and Hit Dice. When it reverts to its normal form, it returns to the number of hit points it had before it morphed. However, if it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form.
When you gain the Primal Strikes feature at 6th level, that feature applies to your familiar's attacks while morphed.

subclassFeature.name: Team Attack
entries: Starting at 7th level, if you take the {@action Attack} action or Multiattack action and your familiar can see you, your familiar can use its reaction to make a melee attack.

subclassFeature.name: Companion Growth
entries: Beginning at 10th level, your familiar gains two bestial edges that you are qualified to take. When you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of your familiar's edges and replace it with another edge you could learn at that level.

subclassFeature.name: Coordinated Save
entries: Starting at 14th level, whenever your familiar makes a saving throw while it is within 30 feet of you, it gains a bonus to the saving throw equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum bonus of +1). You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Entomology
entries: An entomologist is an animus which studies bugs and insects. While others might feel these creatures are creepy or strange, an entomologist knows that they are animals just like any other, worthy of study and research.

subclassFeature.name: Vermin Expertise
entries: Beginning at 3rd level when you choose this research focus, you gain an affinity with bugs, arachnids, and insect-like creatures. Whenever you make an Intelligence ability check related to these creatures, you add your proficiency bonus to the check if you are not already proficient. If you are proficient, your proficiency bonus for any such ability check is doubled.

Additionally, you can morph into a {@creature swarm of insects}, a form which is always prepared for you and which does not count against the number of forms you have prepared. Your swarm form deals its normal damage while you have any temporary hit points remaining from morphing into it, and its reduced damage if you do not have any of these temporary hit points remaining.

entries.name: Variant Insect Swarms
entries: Different kinds of insects can gather in swarms. You can choose any of the options below for your swarm of insects form, so long as you are not otherwise prevented from doing so (for example, you must be 8th level in order to morph into a {@creature swarm of wasps}).

items: {@creature Swarm of Beetles}
{@creature Swarm of Centipedes}
{@creature Swarm of Spiders}
{@creature Swarm of Wasps}

subclassFeature.name: Skittering
entries: Also at 3rd level, you gain the ability to move through any other creature's space, no matter its size.

subclassFeature.name: Swarm Form
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can morph into a swarm of insects that is a higher challenge rating than your normal swarm of insects form, expending ki points for higher forms as normal.
An empowered swarm has the following changes to its stat block:

entries.caption: Insect Swarm
footnotes: † This replaces the bonus to hit for the swarm's bite attack.
‡ Your additional bite attacks can be made against the same or different targets in the swarm's space.

subclassFeature.name: Coccoon
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can spend 10 minutes weaving a cocoon, which completely covers your body. While in your cocoon, you are restrained and unaware of your surroundings unless a creature takes an action to get your attention or you take any damage. You can emerge from your cocoon using half of your movement.
While in your cocoon, you finish a long rest in only 4 hours, and you recover all expended Hit Dice.

If you are at 0 hit points but are stable, you begin a slow process of exuding silk over your body, creating a cocoon over the course of 10 minutes. Spending 4 hours in this cocoon grants you the benefits of a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hive-Mind
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can use an action and expend one use of Wild Shape to summon a cloud of buzzing, angry insects in a 10-foot radius around you for 1 minute. Until the insects leave, the area is difficult terrain, and when a creature moves into or within the area, it takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.
If you are in your swarm of insects form during this time, your swarm of insects form also gains these properties.

subclassFeature.name: Faeology
entries: While most animi study the world as they see and understand it around them, animi who focus on the unknown seek to learn that which many consider to be incomprehensible: magic. Animi who focus on this type of research learn to harness their ki to understand the nature of magic and how it can be replicated and understood.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Expertise
entries: Beginning at 3rd level when you choose this research focus, you gain an affinity for fey creatures. Whenever you make an Intelligence ability check related to these creatures, you add your proficiency bonus to the check if you are not already proficient. If you are proficient, your proficiency bonus for any such ability check is doubled.
Additionally, you can morph into a {@creature blink dog}, a form which is always prepared for you and which does not count against the number of forms you have prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Call of the Wild
entries: Also at 3rd level, you gain the ability to cast spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter druid spell list|spells|class=druid}. You learn an additional druid cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries: You also learn how to cast spells. Whenever you finish a long rest and prepare forms for morphing, you can choose to prepare fewer forms than your maximum number of prepared forms. For each space you leave open, you can instead fill it with a spell from the druid spell list. Any spells you choose must be of a level no higher than the maximum level of spells you can cast, as shown in the Max Spell Level column of the Faeologist Spellcasting table.

To cast a spell you have prepared, you must expend a number of ki points equal to the spell's level. Your spells are ki abilities, so you use your ki ability whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. Starting at 7th level, you can increase the level of a spell by expending additional ki points. The spell's level increases by 1 for each additional ki point you expend, to a maximum of your maximum spell level.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast a spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Bond
entries: Starting at 7th level, whenever you finish a long rest and prepare forms and spells, you can prepare two additional spells. These spells do not count against the number of forms you have prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Seasonal Boon
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can use an action to choose a season, causing a berry to sprout in an unoccupied space of your choice within 15 feet of you. A creature that eats such a berry as an action gains the benefit listed, depending on the season of the berry you chose.

entries.name: Spring
entries: The creature that eats this berry can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action once during the next hour. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Summer
entries: The creature that eats this berry can add {@damage 1d10} fire damage to one successful melee attack made within the next hour.

entries.name: Autumn
entries: The creature that eats this berry can choose to gain advantage on one saving throw that it makes within the next hour.

entries.name: Winter
entries: The creature that eats this berry can reduce a target's speed to 0 for 1 round on one successful melee attack made within the next hour.
You can cause two berries to sprout, and regain any expended uses whenever you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fae Resilience
entries: Starting at 14th level, the power of fae magic courses ever stronger through you. You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to {@condition sleep|unconscious}.
In addition, you no longer need to sleep. You must still meditate quietly for at least 4 hours to receive the benefits of a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Monstrology
entries: Animi who make monstrosities their focus go outside of the natural world in their research, studying creatures which have been classified as unnatural horrors. While animi pursuing this study might be seen as eccentric at best, their research is invaluable in investigating those creatures which many would say are magical accidents that should be destroyed.

subclassFeature.name: Monster Expertise
entries: Beginning at 3rd level when you choose this research focus, you gain an affinity with monstrosities. Whenever you make an Intelligence ability check related to these creatures, you add your proficiency bonus to the check if you are not already proficient. If you are proficient, your proficiency bonus for any such ability check is doubled.

Additionally, you can prepare and morph into some monstrosities as though they were beasts (see the Animus Monstrosity list). However, as highly magical creatures, it requires more of your energy to morph into them. You must expend one additional ki point to morph into a monstrosity of challenge rating 4 or lower, and two additional ki points to morph into a monstrosity of CR 5 or higher. The monstrous forms you take do not have fly or swim speeds until you reach the appropriate level of the Animal Morphs table.

When you use a trait or take an action that can only be used a limited number of times each day (such as a {@creature darkmantle}'s Darkness Aura trait), you can only use that feature the number of times listed as part of the feature, even if you morph into the creature multiple times or you morph into a different creature with the same feature.

entries.caption: Animus Monstrosity List
rows: {@creature Manticore}, {@creature Owlbear}, {@creature Phase spider}, {@creature Winter wolf}

subclassFeature.name: Sudden Mutation
entries: Also at 3rd level, whenever you finish a long rest, you can choose one of your bestial edges and replace it with another edge.

subclassFeature.name: Changing Bodies
entries: Starting at 7th level, you gain the ability to share some of your bestial edges with other creatures. You can spend 10 minutes concentrating, taking no actions and expending no movement. At the end of this time, you can choose two willing creatures within 10 feet of you and one of your bestial edges. The creatures gain the benefits of that bestial edge until you finish your next long rest. Once you share a bestial edge in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Shifting Form
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can expend 2 ki points as an action to cast the {@spell alter self} spell. You can cast this spell while morphed.

subclassFeature.name: Balefull Morph
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can attempt to trap a creature's mind in a new body. As an action, you can touch a creature and expend 4 ki points to cast the {@spell polymorph} spell on that creature. The target can only be transformed into a beast you have prepared for morphing.

subclassFeature.name: Oceanography
entries: Oceanographers study in the most inhospitable places in the world—the depths of the ocean. Marine life encompasses a multitude of different animals, and oceanographers travel to some of the most difficult-to-reach locations in order to study and research these creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Aquatic Expertise
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you choose this research focus, you gain an affinity with creatures that have innate swimming speeds. Whenever you make an Intelligence ability check related to these creatures, you add your proficiency bonus to the check if you are not already proficient. If you are proficient, your proficiency bonus for any such ability check is doubled.
Additionally, you can ignore the swimming speed limitation of the Animal Morphs table.
Finally, you gain proficiency with {@item navigator's tools|PHB} and vehicles (water).

subclassFeature.name: Sea Legs
entries: Also at 3rd level, you gain the {@edge Darkvision|McToomin27:Animus} and {@edge Waterborne|McToomin27:Animus} bestial edges (ignoring prerequisites), which do not count against your normal number of bestial edges. You cannot replace either of these edges when you gain a level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Aqueous Adaptations
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your body changes further to allow you to visit the deepest depths of the ocean. You are immune to damage caused by the pressure of being in deep water.
Additionally, you have {@sense blindsight} to a range of 5 feet. While underwater, the range of this {@sense blindsight} increases to 30 feet.
Finally, you can expend 1 ki point as an action to cast the {@spell fog cloud} spell. You can cast this spell while morphed.

subclassFeature.name: Call of the Sea
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can cast the {@spell locate animals or plants} and {@spell water breathing} spells, but only as rituals.

subclassFeature.name: Sea Monster
entries: Beginning at 14th level, you can expend 10 ki points to morph into a {@creature hydra} or a {@creature lesser kraken|McToomin27:Animus} for 10 minutes. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Oozology
entries: Some researchers seek to understand the strangest of life-forms: oozes. There is serious debate amongst animi as to whether oozes are even truly alive in the traditional sense, or whether they are simply magically animated slime which works towards a mysterious purpose.

subclassFeature.name: Slime Expertise
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you choose this focus, you gain an affinity with oozes. Whenever you make an Intelligence ability check related to these creatures, you add your proficiency bonus to that check if you are not already proficient. If you are proficient, your proficiency bonus for any such ability check is doubled.
Additionally, you can prepare and Wild Shape into oozes as though they were beasts.

subclassFeature.name: Ooze Morph
entries: Also at 3rd level, when you Wild Shape into a beast, you can choose to become an ooze in the shape of that beast. While in your Ooze Morph, the following rules apply:

items: The creature's type is changed to ooze.
You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
You are immune to acid damage and have immunity to the {@condition grappled} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Duplicate
entries: Beginning at 7th level, the bits of ooze that fall off of you in battle gain their own life. When you are morphed into an ooze and you take damage, you can use your reaction to split an {@creature oozeling|McToomin27:Animus} off of yourself.

An oozeling takes its turn on your initiative and obeys your orders. You can direct an oozeling where to move within 60 feet of you (no action required by you), and you can use a bonus action to direct an oozeling to take the {@action Attack}, {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Dodge}, or {@action Help} actions. If you do not give it an order, an oozeling does nothing. If an oozeling is ever more than 60 feet from you, it will attempt to return to that area by any means necessary. An oozeling disappears if you dismiss it as an action, its hit points drop to 0, or when your Wild Shape ends.

subclassFeature.name: Beware the Blob
entries: Starting at 10th level, whenever you are morphed into an ooze, you gain the following properties:

items.name: Engulf
entries: As an action, you can move 5 feet into the space of a creature that is your size or smaller. Whenever you enter a creature's space, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw.

On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of you. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw. On a failed save, you enter the creature's space, and the creature takes 10 ({@dice 3d6}) acid damage and is {@i engulfed}. The {@i engulfed} creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 21 ({@dice 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of your turns. When you move, the {@i engulfed} creature moves with you.

An {@i engulfed} creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a Strength check (DC equal to your morph save DC). On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of you.

items.name: Ooze Cube
entries: Creatures {@i engulfed} by you can be seen but have total cover. A creature within 5 feet of you can take an action to pull a creature or object out of you. Doing so requires a successful Strength check (DC equal to your morph save DC), and the creature making the attempt takes 10 ({@dice 3d6}) acid damage. You can hold one creature of your size or four creatures that are smaller than you inside you at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Slime Horde
entries: Beginning at 14th level, you can issue orders to up to three {@creature oozeling|McToomin27:Animus|oozelings} under your control with your bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Primordiology
entries: Some animi seek to understand the creatures that existed before all others: elementals. There is contention as to whether elementals should truly be included in taxonomies with other creatures, as their forms can often be alien and unlike any other creatures which exist. Nevertheless, animi who study these creatures see how their primal forms gave rise to the land, seas, and sky, and seek to emulate their power.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Expertise
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you choose this research focus, you gain an affinity with elementals. Whenever you make an Intelligence ability check related to these creatures, you add your proficiency bonus to the check if you are not already proficient. If you are proficient, your proficiency bonus for any such ability check is doubled.

Additionally, you can prepare and morph into {@filter elementals|bestiary|type=elemental|miscellaneous=!swarm} as though they were beasts. However, as highly magical creatures, it requires more of your energy to morph into them. You must expend one additional ki point to morph into an elemental of challenge rating 4 or lower, and two additional ki points to morph into an elemental of CR 5 or higher. The elemental forms you take do not have fly or swim speeds until you reach the appropriate level of the Animal Morphs table.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Form
entries: Also at 3rd level, when you morph into a beast, you can choose to become an air, earth, fire, or water elemental (your choice) in the shape of that beast. While in your Elemental Form, the following rules apply:

items: Your type is changed to elemental.
You are immune to the {@condition prone} condition.
You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Protection
entries: Beginning at 7th level, whenever you are morphed into an elemental, you gain an additional ability determined by your elemental type:

entries.name: Air
entries: When you are subject to a ranged weapon attack from a creature you can see, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Earth
entries: You deal double damage to objects and structures, and while you are standing on earth or stone, your walking speed increases by 10 feet.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Once per turn when a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the attacker takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage.

entries.name: Water
entries: You can use your action to make a {@action grapple} or {@action shove} attack against a creature within 15 feet of you. Once on each of your turns, you can move a target {@condition grappled} by you in this way anywhere within 15 feet of you (no action required).

If you morph into an elemental but which does not have an explicit type (such as a {@creature magmin}), you gain the ability described above which best fits your form (subject to your GM's discretion).

subclassFeature.name: Grove of the Ancients
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can cast the {@spell elemental grove|McToomin27:Animus} spell, but only as a ritual. When you do so, you can choose air, earth, fire, or water versions of any of the spell's effects.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Ally
entries: Beginning at 14th level, when you morph into an elemental, you can summon mephits to aid you. You summon one mephit if your form is of challenge rating 4 or lower, or two mephits if your form is of CR 5 or higher. You choose the mephits that appear based on your elemental type:

entries.name: Air
entries: {@creature Dust Mephit|MM|Dust} or {@creature Ice Mephit|MM|ice} mephits.

entries.name: Earth
entries: {@creature Dust Mephit|MM|Dust} or {@creature Magma Mephit|MM|magma} mephits.

entries.name: Fire
entries: {@creature Magma Mephit|MM|Magma} or {@creature Steam Mephit|MM|steam} mephits.

entries.name: Water
entries: {@creature Ice Mephit|MM|Ice} or {@creature Steam Mephit|MM|steam} mephits.

subclassFeature.name: Zoology
entries: While other animi study fantastical and rare creatures, zoologists know the value of beasts and their many incredible forms. Zoologists come to know beasts both great and small, and even those creatures which have gone extinct.

subclassFeature.name: Phytological Expertise
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you choose this focus, you gain an affinity with oozes. Whenever you make an Intelligence ability check related to these creatures, you add your proficiency bonus to that check if you are not already proficient. If you are proficient, your proficiency bonus for any such ability check is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Animal Assistant
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell, but only as a ritual (Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell). Your familiar can take the form of any creature you have prepared which is of CR 1 or lower. Unlike a normal familiar, your familiar can attack on its turn.

subclassFeature.name: Natural Talent
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you gain two additional bestial edges of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Blessings of the Wild
entries: Starting at 10th level, your animal adaptations take root. You only require half the normal amount of food and water a creature of your size would require.

In addition, you have advantage on any Constitution check or saving throw you make to survive or move through areas with severe natural environments such as extreme cold, extreme heat, high winds, heavy precipitation, high altitudes, and other, similar environments.

subclassFeature.name: King of Beasts
entries: Beginning at 14th level, when you use Wild Shape, you can choose to exceed the maximum CR of creatures you can morph into for the purposes of your Unleash Fury feature. When you do so, your Max CR is considered to be equal to your animus level for that morph. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
